lines.text: They think they can give me a college education
Well, I vow sometimes educated people has less brains than fools
Wouldn't you want me to go?

I'd rather you go to college than anything in the whole world, but just where they think we can raise that kind of money when your father even worked overtime to get you a graduation ring, did you ever see university boys, there rich boys, their daddys have money or they wouldn't even let them inside the gates.
Must you, we got company!

[drunk]
Come open your arms because I'm going to kiss those ruby lips right off you
[attempting to kiss her]
Oh Clay Stop it! Behave yourself the minister and Ms Parker are in there
Oh good for Ms Parker
[continues to kiss and grab his wife]
Clay Stop Clay!
I love you woman
I can now all I need was the boy being accepted, he's my Collateral
[he leaves]
[Dean's secretary leaves]
You must live for days like this.
[to the Dean]
The world steps aside to let any man pass if he knows where he is going.
I learned to cuss before I could walk.
You mean to say that not one single hymn-shoutin', foot-washin' hypocrite showed up?

[concerned about the new preacher's supposed drinking]
I've heard rumors that...

Bah! He never had a drink in his life before *I* poured it on him. I'd sure hate to see your whole congregation get stunk up tonight. Once them skunks start sprayin' their skunk juice around, they say you *never* get the stink out.

[to all his younger siblings]
What are you kids doing here? Back to bed, all of you!

[to Patty-Cake]
And if you get up another time tonight, I'm gonna' spank your behind so shiny you can see yourself in it!
Who's kidding who? They just don't want me! Can't you see that?
It wouldn't surprise me at all if the good lord Himself kept Clayboy from gettin' that scholarship.
Why'd the Lord wanna' do that?

Well, after the graduation we were all so puffed up, and braggin' about him so, and, well, pride cometh before a fall. If the Lord put you on this earth to be poor, poor you're going to be. And if you're born ignorant, well then you're destined to *die* ignorant!
Where the hell did you pick up a piece of information like that?
In the Bible, and you stop swearing!
Show me where it says something like that!
Well, I, I can't exactly show you *where,* but I heard a preacher...
Woman, you been listening to too many preachers!

[looking at portrait paintings on the wall outside the dean's office]
Well, they look smart, but I wonder if any of 'em ever did an honest day's work?
What do you have against preachers?
It's what they preach *against* I'm against.
I'm afraid I don't understand?
They're against everything I'm for. They don't allow drinkin' or smokin', card playin', pool shootin', dancin', cussin' - or huggin', kissin' and lovin'. And mister, I'm for *all* of them things.
Papa dead?
No, he's alive, Clay, but it can't be for long. He's broken nearly every bone in his body. I gave him enough morphine to get him down the mountain.

[to Clayboy]
Better get down there, son. Prepare the women for bad news.

[as Clayboy prepares to leave for college]
Don't take up any fancy ways, Clayboy. Trust in God and go to church.

Clayboy has boarded the bus, leaving home for college]
Goin' far, son?
Right far.
